name: versionCompare
description: Compares two software version numbers (e.g. "1.7.1" or "1.2b").

unknown.tagValue: {Number|NaN} 0 / equals; -1 / smaller; +1 / higher; NaN / wrong format

params.name: v1
params.description: The first version to be compared.

params.name: v2
params.description: The second version to be compared.

params.name: options
params.description:
Optional flags that affect comparison behavior:

lexicographical: true | compares each part of the version strings lexicographically
instead of naturally; this allows suffixes such as "b" or "dev" but will cause "1.10"
to be considered smaller than "1.2".

zeroExtend: true | changes the result if one version string has less parts than the other.
In this case the shorter string will be padded with "zero" parts instead of being considered smaller.

return.description: 0 / equals; -1 / smaller; +1 / higher; NaN / wrong format
